_header: Go forth mine heart with my lady
Bibliographic Ghosts:
Grenoble, Bibl. municipale, Grenoble 873: ghost in spite of references to editions by Champollion-Figeac (1842)
XChampollion-Figeac, Aime. Les Poesies du duc Charles d’Orleans. Paris, 1842, 265-6; MacCracken (1911)
XMacCracken, Henry Noble. “An English Friend of Charles d’Orleáns.” PMLA 26 (1911): 142-180, 175.
_description: Charles d’Orléans, The service of his mistress, a roundel — fourteen lines

BLRoy16Fii.First Lines:
GO forth my hert with my ladyLoke that ye spar no
                    bysynes…
BLRoy16Fii.Last Lines:
…ANd þe shal dwell with your mastresIN plaisauns glad and
                    mery
BLRoy16Fii.Editions:

BNfr25458.First Lines:
[G]o forth myn hert wyth my ladyLoke that ye spar no
                    besynes…
BNfr25458.Last Lines:
…And ȝe schal d[o]wel wyth your maistresIn plesans glad
                    and meryGo forth &c.
